concept.title: Instances on Merchandising Variables
concept.shortdesc: Describes how instances are counted on merchandising variables.

conbody.p: Instances are not currently counted for merchandising variables that use Product Syntax. If you have selected Product Syntax and have implemented according to these directions, you should not see instances for this variable. If instances are being counted, it indicates that the eVar is being set in some locations outside of the products string, which is unnecessary.

If you are using Conversion Variable Syntax, an instance is counted each time the variable is set. However, the instance is attributed to "None" unless the following occurs each time the variable is set:

ul.li: The merchandising eVar has a value.

conbody.p: For example, the following instance of eVar1 is allocated to "Outdoors:Ski Goggles":
conbody.codeblock: s.eVar1="Outdoors:Ski Goggles" s.events="prodView" s.products=";Fernie Snow Goggles"
conbody.p: However, in the next example, the instance of eVar1 is allocated to "None" since all conditions are not met when the eVar is set (there is no binding event and the products variable is not set):
Allocation to "None" occurs if you set a value for an eVar on a page where no binding event occurs, or if you set the eVar value in the products string without a binding event.
conbody.note: The current functionality for counting instances on merchandising variables is being reviewed and is scheduled to change in an upcoming release.
